title: Britain needs a new Parliament of MPs who understand what democracy is really all about
text:
It has been a long week in British politics but little has actually changed. Seven days ago, the Government had a withdrawal deal agreed with the EU and planned to leave by October 31. It looked like it might actually, finally, do it. Then MPs passed the Letwin amendment – meaning that Parliament would withhold support for the deal until the relevant legislation had passed.

Parliament debated the legislation and voted to proceed, but immediately rejected the Government’s timetable. Realising that MPs meant to delay and amend the Withdrawal Agreement Bill to the point that it was not Brexit at all, the Government withdrew the Bill. “Can we at least have an election?” asked Boris Johnson. “I’ll...
description: It has been a long week in British politics but little has actually changed.
